align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2163965"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2163965#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2161542" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2161542" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Blackcat808"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1525014"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1525014.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Blackcat808" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-s-Secret/Tease-Eau-de-Parfum-2020-64012.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64012.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tease Eau de Parfum 2020"title="Tease Eau de Parfum 2020"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2161542ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2161542" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1525014">Blackcat808</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-19">05/19/24 21:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I, too, was one of those that didn't know what to think of Cloud at first. The way it was described was not what I got from initial sniff but it quickly grew on me and now I'm obsessed  <br />
<br />
It's creamy, fluffy, airy, whipped, sweet but not syrupy, a bit toasted/smokey. Cloud is honestly the *perfect* name for it. It's got this interesting "ozonic" quality that almost smells kind of cold? At first I got a bit of a unisex vibe with the lavender and woody notes but the more I wear it the less I get that. I can also distinctly smell the coconut now but it's not in beachy way, rather, it's in a more coconut cream way. Absolutely addictive. <br />
<br />
<br />
Cloud comparisons:<br />
<br />
Compared to Intense 2.0 - <br />
super similar but OG Cloud is a little lighter, smoother, less dense, less lavender and more coconut. 2.0 is a bit more sharp and potent, for sure. There's more of a "kick" to it. <br />
<br />
Compared to Cloud Pink - <br />
Pink is definitely fruitier and rather than fluffy, whipped coconut cream - it's got a sort of cotton candy-ness instead. I actually think Pink is a bit more musky aswell but it's about 75% the same DNA.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2161542"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2161542#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2160029" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2160029" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tessi123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678699"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1678699.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tessi123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/Idole-Nectar-74137.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74137.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Idle Nectar"title="Idle Nectar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2160029ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2160029" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678699">tessi123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-18">05/18/24 09:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I know this is so popular and the notes look amazing to me but I actually can't stand it. There is this weird plastic-y burnt hair () chemical smell that I can't get past. It seems like some people get the plastic smell and some don't. One of the worst fragrances to my nose. Sad because if I actually picked up the notes I think I would love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2160029"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2160029#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2159884" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2159884" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Similarien"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1936422"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1936422.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Similarien" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Crivelli/Iris-Malikhan-62617.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62617.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Malikhn"title="Iris Malikhn"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2159884ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2159884" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1936422">Similarien</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-18">05/18/24 05:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>BR540 dupe. Indeed, its not exactly like BR540 becasue it is made of cheap synthetics.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2159884"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2159884#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2156255" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2156255" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Krystyn Moon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2024860"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2024860.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Krystyn Moon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2156255ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2156255" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2024860">Krystyn Moon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-14">05/14/24 21:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think it is a good overall sent. I would even say its a good beginner sent to try out if you are looking for something sweet. I have read the comments and I somewhat agree that it does smell slightly synthetic but not to the degree I wouldn't recommend it. It lasts a for a decent amount of time. The smell will last all day if you spray it on your clothes. I will say though it would fit a younger audience better. I don't believe this is wouldn't fit any formal setting. Unfortunately it is not one I would purchase again just because it does not match my perfume taste I have today but I do recommend trying it in store before purchasing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2156255"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2156255#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2154591" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2154591" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="godajb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1650605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1650605.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="godajb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Valentino-Donna-Born-In-Roma-Intense-78739.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78739.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valentino Donna Born In Roma Intense"title="Valentino Donna Born In Roma Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2154591ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2154591" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1650605">godajb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-13">05/13/24 09:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells very immature and absolutely stinks on me. I used up a 30ml bottle several years ago and bought a 100ml one, but now it's hidden in my drawer because i never use it. I don't know if this is a bad batch or something, but even out of the bottle it smells very synthetic and reminds me of sour sweat. Maybe it's too old. Or i'm too old. Anyway, it doesn't last at all either.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2154591"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2154591#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2153556" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2153556" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="michelle.schlossman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/893678"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.893678.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="michelle.schlossman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Eau-De-Toilette-17478.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17478.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Eau De Toilette"title="Miss Dior Eau De Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2153556ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2153556" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/893678">michelle.schlossman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-12">05/12/24 08:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like Rite Guard aerosol deodorant for men. I like the bottle though. For some reason it reminds me of the backgrounds in the old Super Mario Nintendo games. <br />
This scent has grown on me. It is nice if applied lightly and layered with the right products. Its when Ppl overspray it becomes too synthetic and cloying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2153556"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2153556#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2152891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2152891" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="azaleahs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2129391"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2129391.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="azaleahs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2152891ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2152891" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2129391">azaleahs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-11">05/11/24 13:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its a shame the pear is too invisible in this scent. I like it. Very feminine, fresh and fruity. Simple formula; suitable for any wear. I see why it is a well loved scent. One of it cons is how known it is and the first perfume connotation it has. You will never be asked what youre wearing because every girl and their mom tried it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2152891"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2152891#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2152583" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2152583" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vminie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vminie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2152583ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2152583" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906">vminie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-11">05/11/24 06:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you like vanilla-coconutty scents, this is actually good. I was pleasantly surprised by this. I thought it will just smell like another BBW mist that is too sweet and cloying; but it came out decent that I didn't mind wearing it to the office and worry I'd smell obnoxiously sweet. It's not something I'd easily reach for on the daily, though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2152583"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2152583#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2151474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2151474" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PhantomBelle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029931"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2029931.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PhantomBelle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narcotica/Narco-Oasis-84576.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84576.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narco Oasis"title="Narco Oasis"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2151474ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2151474" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029931">PhantomBelle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-10">05/10/24 05:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like this a lot more than Cloud Pink, I would buy a full size of this if it was on sale (wouldn't pay retail for it). I get some lavender, some vanilla orchid &amp; cream, a lot ot musk and woody notes. It's a good blend and it's easy to understand why this is so popular. Moderate lasting power and decent projection. Work safe, blind buy safe in the travel size. Purchased from: Ulta</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2151474"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2151474#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2150973" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2150973" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bibinno"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1435523"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1435523.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bibinno" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2150973ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2150973" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1435523">bibinno</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-09">05/09/24 16:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i'm a little sentimentally attached to cloud because it was my first "big girl" fragrance (i.e. not a vs/impulse/so...? body spray) that i could finally afford with my own money and i no longer had to rely on the often heavier jasmine and oud-scented middle eastern perfumes and attors i grew up on.<br />
<br />
this is a really pleasant scent that i've learnt is best used for when i intend to enjoy my own company. it comes out very plasticky lavender at first but then the cleaner, juicier notes become more pronounced. i've started layering it with my noted aromas dupe for tom ford's lost cherry (which smells almost 100% like marzipan/frangipane) and it does a great job of bringing out cloud's more gourmand, lactonic and marshmallow-y notes. i actually think it's all these different sides that keeps me coming back for more! by itself, cloud is far from being commendable on its sillage and longevity (which lasts around 2-3 hours on me) but somehow, i'm convinced that i'm going to be a repeat customer so long as it's on sale xD inoffensive, affordable and a safe option for my amateur perfume collection! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="2150973"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=2150973#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="50384" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1096396" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1096396" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hazygem"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188771"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1188771.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hazygem" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-est-Belle-en-Rose-53345.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53345.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie est Belle en Rose"title="La Vie est Belle en Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1096396ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1096396" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188771">hazygem</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-09-10">09/10/19 14:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This wont win me any popularity contests, but honestly Cloud is nearly identical to the dry down, and performs better than BR540 in terms of projection and lasting power. I detect it strongly for a good 4-5 hours, and can smell it on clothing literally days after wearing it.  Cloud is a little sweeter, a little more rounded edges, and skips the medicinal opening of BR 540. Because of its opening, Id say that BR 540 is definitely more unisex. Cloud is linear, which to me is good news. I get right to the part I love about BR540 and skip the resiny note that I dont care for as much. <br />
<br />
Again, this will upset people, but I truly feel that when people pay a lot for something their brain will attach more value to it just because its expensive.  For example, its my understanding that Baccarat Rouge is almost entirely synthetic, yet people assume the notes listed are ingredients to the perfume rather than (synthetic) aromachemicals adding up to what were *supposed* to smell in the fragrance.  Using synthetic as a pejorative when discussing perfume is just ridiculous and indicates that one probably doesnt really know much about the subject.  <br />
<br />
As for the reviewers who agree Cloud is a dupe but are angry at Ariana Grande about it:  LOL. Welcome to the wonderful world of gourmands.  Im glad MFK created one you can enjoy.  There are good ones all over if youre not too snotty to try them _()_/<br />
No hate to BR 540 or those who prefer it!  It is enjoying its moment of hype right now and Im glad for it. Maybe itll help more people stop clutching their  bottles of Mitsouko and move into the 21st century.  But if youre not a frag head, perfumista, or SERIOUS collector and you just want a perfume that smells great and lasts?  By all means, buy the Cloud!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1096396"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1096396#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1072118" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1072118" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="teresathebarista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/516677"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.516677.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="teresathebarista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Avon/Imari-Seduction-1867.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1867.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Imari Seduction"title="Imari Seduction"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1072118ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1072118" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/516677">teresathebarista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-21">06/21/19 19:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I grew up poor. The first time I sprayed this on my wrist, I told my husband, "This smells like rich girls in my high school." I don't know what it was that the rich girls were wearing in the late '90s, early 2000s, but that's the feeling it gave me at first. <br />
<br />
Upon dry down, I could not stop sniffing my wrist. I've since gone through two purse sprayers and have already bought my third. I'm gonna have to cave and buy the large bottle. This is my new favorite scent. <br />
<br />
It's creamy and soft. It's sweet without being putrid. It's dark and luxurious. It's warm and inviting. It's a coconut cream hug wrapped in cashmere.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1072118"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1072118#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1210203" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1210203" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Palmer Eldritch"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202620"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1202620.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Palmer Eldritch" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Mayar-84309.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84309.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mayar"title="Mayar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1210203ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1210203" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202620">Palmer Eldritch</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-11">08/11/20 12:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>100% more enjoyable and crowd-pleasing than BR540. <br />
In my opinion anyway. Even if you hate this scent, chances are 95% of people around you won't.<br />
<br />
FIELD REPORT: I tested this for 5-6 days before the pandemic got severe and got FAR MORE positive comments and compliments in the city than with BR540, mostly from 25-35 year old guys. <br />
<br />
Long-story short: It's a more gourmand, sugary version of BR540. There is an uncanny resemblance. 'Cloud' leans a little on the synthetic side, but it's not bitter, cloying or offensive. Actually it's rather seductive.<br />
<br />
DOWNSIDE: Performance is not that great. Don't expect serious silage or longevity. Although most reviewers experienced great performance.<br />
<br />
Verdict: Try before you buy. Great for winter &amp; fall for all occasions. Certified compliment-collector.  <br />
<br />
P.S. I see some salty BR540 fans in the reviews LOL.<br />
Don't take them seriously. Also stop shaming people for loving 'Cloud' over a $300 perfume. It doesn't matter if the fragrance you love is a dupe or low-cost, what's important is if it makes YOU happy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1210203"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1210203#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1004849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1004849" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Taliera"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/4533"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.4533.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Taliera" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Voyage-Royal/The-Two-Roses-70560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Two Roses"title="The Two Roses"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1004849ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1004849" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/4533">Taliera</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-28">11/28/18 03:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I first tried Baccarat Rouge 540, the marketing and hype was making me believe this would be an exquisitely crafted, top of the range, fit for royalty scent... And my honest response was "Mmm, I like it... But it doesn't smell that much different to a celebrity scent." I felt embarrassed and tried to raise my opinion of it, since it seemed far more likely that I was just not sophisticated enough to appreciate the true depth of this beautiful work of art. But every time I tried it after, I just couldn't motivate myself to part with my cash for the enormous price tag. I said one day, cynically, to the sales assistant "If this had the price of a celebrity scent, I'd get it." <br />
<br />
Well!! Turns out I was right all along... Now I can have "the real" Baccarat Rouge 540.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1004849"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1004849#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1179334" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1179334" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bolla2909"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33466"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.33466.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bolla2909" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Ari-31661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ari"title="Ari"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1179334ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1179334" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33466">bolla2909</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-23">05/23/20 11:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I already did a rather long review on BR540, which I'm not a fan of but I really love this one. But it took a while. I'm going to try to explain the main difference here, because they are very much alike, but at the same time very different for one big reason. I'd also want to touch on the subject of fragrance snobbery because these two have definitely ruffled some feathers when people compare mainstream to niche - but that would fill up a book. So perhaps that will be for another time.<br />
<br />
Anyway. <br />
<br />
Cloud. By Ariana Grande. Or more precisely Clement Gavarry.<br />
Let's just get one thing out of the way first. The bottle. Let it be known that bottles are usually not something I care for all that much. But (and this is a big but). Who in their right mind adds this chunky and tacky plastic to the outfit of the scent? Seriously? In this day and age when we know better. The bottle itself could just have been shaped like a cloud if this was of such importance to the design team. The bottle itself, once saved from the plastic prison looks rather generic and not offensive. Apart from the fact that the name of the fragrance is nowhere to be seen once you remove it from the box. The cloud has "Ariana Grande" written on it and so does the bottle itself, but the actual name isn't there, not even on the bottom. Perhaps you are not supposed to throw the plastic monster out like I did and just "get" the name by looking at that bottle-in-cloud situation. Who knows. Out of all the fragrances I own, this is the only one that doesn't have the name of the fragrance on the bottle. It seems rather tacky to only have the name of Ms. Grande on the bottle, but then again, I'm definitely not the intended target group for any of her fragrances. There are for sure people out there that want her name to be prominent on what they own and use. I'm just not one of them.<br />
Bottle rant over.<br />
<br />
Now on to the scent itself and the BR540 comparison. <br />
This is very blatantly a rip off. There's no denying it. Does it smell exactly the same? No. Obviously not. Does it smell alike enough to trick people? Yes. <br />
The note list for Cloud is completely different from BR540 but then again, notes listed do often not tell you much in regards to what the scent smells like. There's so much science that goes into fragrance making and even two different fragrances with almost identical note lists often smell nothing alike. These two are a good example of this. Both smell like there's a cloud around you (I have to give Ms. Grande's team a pat on the back for actually coming up with a name that's the perfect fit but in Mr. Kurkdjians defense, it would have been a bit peculiar of him to make his scent and name it "Cloud", and then stand firmly behind it at niche world Olympics saying "yes yes, this is serious and niche, buy Cloud and smell rich". No, that would never have worked). It creates a very pleasant and sweet aura around the wearer, it's this candy flossy, sugary sweet scent, that surprisingly isn't too sweet at the same time. Some fragrances actually smell like you overdosed on fruit that overdosed on sugar, but this stays far from that territory. Cloud is soft and fluffy and isn't loud or obnoxious. I wouldn't call it a sexy scent, rather a happy and cuddly one. I feel it suits many occasions and outfits, spring, summer, winter and fall. Day and night. It's versatile and  easy to wear. <br />
<br />
And now onto what's alike and what's not alike with those two. <br />
I don't like BR540. In fact it irritates me and even on others, I have to back away from them if they've been generous with the sprays. One thing that struck me trying them out was the medicinal smell that I smelled as soon as I took the cap off. When I got my sample of BR540 the whole box that was full of other samples reeked. I thought something had happened. It literally smells like iodine and my dentist's office, with some old band aids thrown in. The same thing happened when I smelled Cloud first. I thought the bottle had gone bad. But I could still smell something very pretty underneath. I've since then learned that the Saffron note in BR540 is most likely the reason for this because of it's medicinal qualities. There is no Saffron listed in Cloud and they might well be using something else with similar effects but after a couple of wearings, my nose grew to like it. I don't consider myself fully equipped to write a review unless I've worn a scent for a while so everything I write about has been worn a lot. The same goes for BR540. But there the Saffron overpowers everything to me. <br />
<br />
And the biggest difference? Cloud has considerably less band aid smell compared to BR540 so if you dislike BR540 because of that, give Cloud a try. If you do a wrist test, with each scent on each wrist and compare them, yes you can tell the difference. BR540 is far more complicated and has some better quality ingredients. The sillage and longevity are also very different - Cloud doesn't announce its presence before you enter a room, it actually sits pretty close to you but the longevity on me is rather impressive, I can smell it on my wrist the following day until I take a shower. BR540 on the other hand is loud, you will not miss a person wearing it in the same room. I do not want to fill a room ever, I think that's not attractive and I want people only to be able to smell my perfume if they're standing close. So for that reason alone I'd choose Cloud. People looking for leaving a big trail behind them will not be happy with what Cloud offers. <br />
<br />
So, unless you have both on each wrist to compare, I don't think you can spot that big of a difference, and of course, one is a monster while the other is fairly tame. <br />
<br />
Overall I'd say Cloud is a good fragrance for the price you pay. I'd even suggest that you'd get that one over BR540 if you don't care to fill up a room with your fragrance. I know a lot of niche lovers will hate on me for saying this but I stand by my opinion. A good fragrance is just a good fragrance, regardless of price. Although I'd love to see that ugly plastic cloud be gone, but you can't always get what you want and so in the recycling bin it goes. But that's my only complaint.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1179334"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1179334#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="50384" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1040622" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1040622" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="juliaten"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/170578"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.170578.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="juliaten" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1040622ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1040622" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/170578">juliaten</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-13">03/13/19 10:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Does anyone else smells plastic in this fragrance? I like the first few minutes of this fragrance but eventually it turns into a smell of burnt plastic or something similar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1040622"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1040622#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1204222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1204222" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Drnonododo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201664"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1201664.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Drnonododo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-London-Dream-60795.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60795.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burberry Her London Dream"title="Burberry Her London Dream"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1204222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1204222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201664">Drnonododo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-26">07/26/20 18:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Don't blind buy this<br />
Don't blind buy this<br />
Don't blind buy this<br />
. <br />
On paper this perfume would be one of my favorites.. <br />
BUT I didn't like it at all! <br />
. <br />
Actually Cloud was in my wish list for a while because of the hype and the notes as I am a huge gourmand lover.. I was so surprised that I didn't get that creamy  sweetness which everybody is describing.<br />
<br />
I wore it daily for a week now in the middle of cold winter in New Zealand.. At the first whiff, I got a plasticy opening which put me off.. After about half an hour I got a familiar annoying scent that took me a while to figure it out..<br />
<br />
WHICH IS ANAESTHETIA <br />
<br />
I smell the hospital and myself like I am going to have a surgery!<br />
<br />
I thought that I got it wrong or I am obsessed with my work at the hospital.. But when my husband smelled me without telling him my thoughts he told me that I smell like a hospital or a surgical gown.. I really don't know what I am doing with my 100ml bottle. <br />
<br />
OMG! I respect all people who love this, they say scents brings memories and sadly this one brings bad ones.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1204222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1204222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1222973" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1222973" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alexandradaos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1232212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="alexandradaos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1222973ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1222973" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1232212">alexandradaos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-09-11">09/11/20 07:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>WHAT IS THIS?<br />
<br />
I blind bought this based on reviews, and mostly because we can't sample anything during these times.<br />
<br />
This is horrible - it honestly smells like cheap men bodyspray (I mean, cheap, supermarket-discount brand) and antacid pills. Is this even perfume? Why would anyone like to smell like pills and rubber?<br />
<br />
There is absolutely no coconut in this, which I hoped for. The lavender is cheap and plasticky - reminiscent of homemade soap. The drydown smells like toothpaste, pills, grandma and something sort of sweet in the background, that I cannot describe (certainly not praline or anything like that). I also get a note that resembles freshly ironed clothes, or that smell your hair has after you use a flat iron.<br />
<br />
In my country of origin, ALL public hospitals smell exactly like this. It makes me project creepy images of operating rooms and sterile surgical instruments.<br />
<br />
Most perfumes I don't like are dislikes because they are either too floraly, too fruity, too rosy, too old-fashioned or give me headaches. This, however, is in a dislike league of its own.<br />
<br />
LE: This is not sweet at all, even if you consider it a male fragrance. By comparison, JPG Le Male is a sweetness bomb compared to this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1222973"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1222973#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1215203" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1215203" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ignorabilis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247368"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1247368.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ignorabilis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Intense-Cafe-18021.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18021.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Intense Cafe"title="Intense Cafe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1215203ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1215203" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247368">ignorabilis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-23">08/23/20 14:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First I want to apologize to everyone who loves Cloud. I know how emotional one can get when a negative review pops up about a beloved perfume. So Im already sorry for the following review.<br />
<br />
I bought a 7,5ml sample of this and have forced myself to wear this all in all for more than seven days now (and still have a lot of it left). I really gave it a try and I wanted to love this so so much. <br />
 <br />
The opening is bizarre. I get the lavender, pear and something sweet but for me they dont blend. Its like every single note tries to stand out on its own so they all seem to be competing with each other instead of blending together. Its pure chaos.<br />
In the dry down the musk becomes more and more prominent  and with the musk I notice a heavy plasticy smell. I mean really heavy!<br />
<br />
The first days I tried this I just couldnt wrap my head around it. I didnt get it and just sat there asking myself Is this really the perfume everyone is raving about?. It was so weird that I couldnt even hate it. I just wore it for hours trying to like it until I scratched it off again when the plastic smell got to heavy. <br />
<br />
To me Cloud by Ariana Grande is a teenage girl, constantly nagging and being overdramatic about the smallest things. She's trying so hard to act like a sophisticated and sexy grown up with her sticky 1$-lipgloss while actually being so indecisive.<br />
<br />
But then she holds so much power and stubbornness! She doesnt know what she wants but she wants it all. This perfume stays on me forever. I mean forever! I sprayed it on my wrist once and 20h later I could still smell it. <br />
<br />
Some days it can be quite fun wearing it because it smells so weird. But I would never consider wearing it for days I want to smell good.<br />
<br />
I have never smelled BR540 so I cant say anything about their similarity. Im talking here about Cloud as Cloud and not Cloud as a BR540 dupe. Since some stated in the reviews though that BR540 smells less plasticy, I can just guess that it would be a more authentic grown-up version of this. <br />
<br />
Maybe this perfume just doesnt work with my skin chemistry at all. It could be that for others it works well. So Ill just leave with saying: This is the absolute opposite of a safe blind buy :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1215203"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1215203#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1211327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1211327" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Luansk&aacute;"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223992"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1223992.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Luansk&aacute;" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/Rose-Rouge-50988.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50988.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Rouge"title="Rose Rouge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1211327ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1211327" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223992">Luansk&aacute;</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-13">08/13/20 23:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I smelled this at Fann yesterday and honestly because of all the hype from Jeremy Fragrance and on YouTube. I don't like it. Very synthetic smelling. Yes there is a soft coconut smell but I don't understand why everyone loves this. Yuck..not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50384"comment_id="1211327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html?ccid=1211327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="50384" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

    <div class="latest-list flex-container">

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
